title: Here's what's coming to Hulu in February 2022 — and what's leaving
text:
The big addition is “Pam & Tommy” (Feb. 2), an original limited series based on the true story of the bootleg Pamela Anderson-Tommy Lee sex tape that went viral in 1997, before that was even a pop-culture term. Lily James (“Downton Abbey”) and Sebastian Stan (“Falcon and the Winter Soldier”) star as the notorious couple, along with Seth Rogen, Nick Offerman and Taylor Schilling. Three episodes will drop Feb. 2, with new eps every following Wednesday.

The Disney DIS-controlled streaming service also has Season 2 of its original comedy series “Dollface” (Feb. 11), starring Kat Dennings; the most recent season of Adult Swim's twisted animated hit “Rick & Morty” (Feb. 5); the Season 5 premiere of FX's underrated '80s drug drama “Snowfall” (Feb. 24); and the premiere of Season 21 of NBC's iconic “Law & Order” (Feb. 25).

More streaming: Here's what's coming in February to  Netflix  |  Amazon Prime Video | HBO Max |

Also: Why Peacock, Apple and HBO Max are streaming must-haves for February 2022 — but Netflix is not

There are also a ton of movies on the way, including recent hits like Guillermo del Toro's “Nightmare Alley” (Feb. 1), the Hulu original survival thriller “No Exit” (Feb. 25), and Matthew Vaughn's action prequel “The King's Man” (Feb. 18), as well as older films such as “Almost Famous,” “The French Connection” and “White Men Can't Jump” (all Feb. 1).

Here's the complete list of what's coming and going, as of Jan. 17 (release dates are subject to change):
